sentences.sContent: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.sCn: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.sContent: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.sCn: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.sContent: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.sCn: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.sContent: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.sCn: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

sentences.sContent: ...A handful of people can recall almost every day of their lives in enormous detail—and after years of research...
...she claimed that she could recall every day of her life since the age of 12...

remMethod.val: re(重新) ＋ call(叫) → 回忆(起)

trans.tranOther: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past
